name: isync
description: Isync is a command-line utility for synchronizing a remote IMAP mailbox to a local Maildir or vice versa.
usage: After installing isync, you can use it to synchronize your email between remote IMAP servers and local Maildir directories.
features: Email Synchronization: Provides tools for synchronizing email between remote IMAP servers and local Maildir directories.
Cross-Platform: Available on multiple operating systems including Windows, Linux, and macOS.
Ease of Use: Offers a command-line interface for email synchronization tasks.
Integration: Can be integrated into email management and backup workflows.
Open Source: An open-source project with a large community of users and contributors.
additional_resources: For more information, visit the Isync documentation and community forums.

name: iwyu
description: IWYU (Include What You Use) is a tool for improving include directives in C and C++ source files.
usage: After installing iwyu, you can use it to analyze and optimize include directives in your C and C++ source files.
features: Include Directive Optimization: Provides tools for analyzing and optimizing include directives in C and C++ source files.
Cross-Platform: Available on multiple operating systems including Windows, Linux, and macOS.
